meanings.definition: The quality or state of being grand or magnificent.
meanings.sent1: The grandeurs of the mountains took my breath away.
meanings.sent2: The ballroom was filled with the grandeurs of chandeliers and gold decorations.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her dollhouse was a palace of grandeurs.
meanings.sent4: The grandeurs of the ancient castle whispered tales of kings and queens.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise painted the sky with grandeurs of pink and orange.

meanings.sent1: The grandeurs of the fireworks display lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The grandeurs of the opera house left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to mimic the grandeurs of a magician but failed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: The grandeurs of the waterfall cascading down the rocks were a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The grandeurs of the royal palace were captured in the artist's painting.

meanings.sent1: The mansion had a grandeur entrance with towering pillars.
meanings.sent2: The grandeur architecture of the cathedral attracted tourists from far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy tried to mimic the grandeur walk of the big dogs.
meanings.sent4: The grandeur oak tree stood tall and proud in the center of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur sunset painted the sky in hues of red and gold.
